newsitem.title: USA: Loews buys 50,000 Delta shrs - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Loews buys 50,000 Delta shrs - WSJ.

text.p: Loews Corp has acquired 50,000 shares of Delta Air Lines for about $4.2 million during the first quarter, the Wall Street Journal said.

In Thursday's electronic edition, the Journal said the investment firm's acquisition raised questions about their intent since it gained control of CBS Inc several years ago after an initial passive investment.
It later sold its 18 percent stake in the CBS television network to Westinghouse Electric Corp for close to $1 billion in 1995.

An unnamed source close to Laurence and Preston Robert Tisch, the brothers who control the investment firm, downplayed the purchase, calling it "just so inconsequential" given the size of Loew's and Delta.
Delta has 76.2 million shares outstanding and market capitalization of $6.8 billion.
A Delta spokesman said the Loews stake does not put it within it top 100 investors.
